com.nnvmso.web
Class PlayerApiController

java.lang.Object
  com.nnvmso.web.PlayerApiController

@Controller
@RequestMapping(value="playerAPI")
public class PlayerApiController
extends java.lang.Object

This is API specification for 9x9 Player. Please note although the document is written in JavaDoc form, it is generic Web Service API via HTTP request-response, no Java necessary.

Example:

Player Request:
http://qa.9x9.tv/playerAPI/brandInfo?mso=9x9

k Service response:
0 success
--
name 9x9
title 9x9.tv

In this document, method name is used as part of the URL, examples:

http://hostname:port/playerAPI/category?lang=en
http://hostname:port/playerAPI/brandInfo?mso=9x9

API categories:

Brand information: brandInfo

Account signup: guestRegister, signup, login, userTokenVerify, signout, requestCaptcha

Account info: setUserPref, getUserProfile, setUserProfile

Directory listing: category

Set related: listRecommended, setInfo, category

Device related: deviceTokenVerify, deviceRegister, deviceAddUser, deviceRemoveUser

Channel: channelLineup, recentlyWatched, search

Program: programInfo

IPG action: moveChannel, channelSubmit, subscribe, unsubscribe

Share: shareByEmail, requestCaptcha

Data collection: pdr, programRemove

Bulletin: staticContent

9x9 Player API always returns a string:

First line is status code and status message, separated by tab.

Different sets of data are separated by "--\n".

Data representation is \t separated of each field, \n separated of each record.

Example 1: login

0 success
--
token a466D491UaaU245P412a
name a

Example 2: category

0 success
--
1201 Movie 5
1203 TV 2
1204 Sports 2

Please note each api's document omits status code and status message.

Basic API flows:

The first step is to call brandInfo to retrieve brand information. It returns brand id, brand logo, and any necessary brand information.

The next step depends on the UI requirement. Use listRecommended to find recommendation sets. Or get an account first. Use userTokenVerify if there's an existing user token. If there's no token at hand, either sign up for user as a guest(guestRegister) or ask user to signup(signup).

To find directory info, trees for category, set, and channel, use category API.

Find individual set information, use setInfo. For channel use channelInfo; programInfo for channel.

Guideline

If there's any API change in terms of return value, new fields will be added to the end of the line, or present in the next block.

Please prepare your player being able to handle it. i.e. existing player should NOT have to modify your code to be able to work with this kind of API change.

key - preference name
value - preference value

                                                                                               javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse resp)

Parameters:

Returns:

Data returns in key and value pair. Key and value is tab separated. Each pair is \n separated.
keys include "name", "email", "gender", "year", "sphere" "ui-lang"

"

Example
: name John
email john@example.com
ui-lang en

setUserProfile

@RequestMapping(value="setUserProfile")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.String> setUserProfile(@RequestParam(value="user",required=false)
                                                                                               java.lang.String user,
                                                                                               @RequestParam(value="key",required=false)
                                                                                               java.lang.String key,
                                                                                               @RequestParam(value="value",required=false)
                                                                                               java.lang.String value,
                                                                                               javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req,
                                                                                               javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse resp)
Set user profile information

Parameters:
user - user token

key - keys include "name", "email", "gender", "year", "sphere", "ui-lang", "password", "oldPassword".
Keys are separated by comma.

value - value that pairs with keys. values are separated by comma. The sequence of value has to be the same as the sequence of keys.

Key and value are used in pairs with corresponding sequence. For example key=name,email,gender&value=john,john@example.com,1

password: if password is provided, oldPassword becomes a mandatory field.

gender: valid gender value is 1 and 0

ui-lang: ui language. Currently valid values are "zh" and "en".

sphere: content region. Currently valid values are "zh" and "en".

brandInfo

@RequestMapping(value="brandInfo")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.String> brandInfo(@RequestParam(value="mso",required=false)
                                                                                          java.lang.String brandName,
                                                                                          javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req,
                                                                                          javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse resp)
Get brand information.

Parameters:
mso - mso name, optional, server returns default mso 9x9 if omitted
Returns:

Data returns in key and value pair. Key and value is tab separated. Each pair is \n separated.
keys include "key", "name", logoUrl", "jingleUrl", "preferredLangCode" "debug", "fbtoken", "read-only"

debug equals one indicates debug mode is turned on. read-only equals one indicates system is currently in read-only mode.

Example:
0 success
--
key 1
name 9x9
title 9x9.tv
logoUrl /WEB-INF/../images/logo_9x9.png
jingleUrl /WEB-INF/../videos/opening.swf
logoClickUrl /
preferredLangCode en
debug 1
locale en

public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.String> login(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req,
                                                                                      javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse resp)
User login. A "user" cookie will be set.

Only POST operation is supported.

Parameters:
email - email
password - password
Returns:
If signup succeeds, the return message will be

preference1 key name (tab) preference1 value (\n)
preference2 key name (tab) preference2 value (\n)
preferences.....

Example:
0 success
--
token QQl0l208W2C4F008980F
name c
lastLogin 1300822489194

subscribe

@RequestMapping(value="subscribe")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.String> subscribe(@RequestParam(value="user",required=false)
                                                                                          java.lang.String userToken,
                                                                                          @RequestParam(value="channel",required=false)
                                                                                          java.lang.String channelId,
                                                                                          @RequestParam(value="set",required=false)
                                                                                          java.lang.String setId,
                                                                                          @RequestParam(value="grid",required=false)
                                                                                          java.lang.String gridId,
                                                                                          @RequestParam(value="pos",required=false)
                                                                                          java.lang.String pos,
                                                                                          javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req,
                                                                                          javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse resp)
User subscribes a channel on a designated grid location.

Example: http://host:port/playerAPI/subscribe?user=QQl0l208W2C4F008980F&channel=51&grid=2

Parameters:
user - user's unique identifier
channel - channelId
set - setId
grid - grid location, from 1 to 81. use with channel
pos - set location, from 1 to 9. use with set
Returns:
status code and status message for the first block;
second block shows channel id, status code and status message

setInfo

@RequestMapping(value="setInfo")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.String> setInfo(@RequestParam(value="set",required=false)
                                                                                        java.lang.String id,
                                                                                        @RequestParam(value="landing",required=false)
                                                                                        java.lang.String beautifulUrl,
                                                                                        javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req,
                                                                                        javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse resp)
Retrieves set information

Parameters:
set - set id
landing - the name used as part of the URL. query with either set or landing
Returns:
first block: status
second block: brand info, returns in key and value pair.
third block: set info, returns in key and value pair
4th block: channel details. reference "channelLineup".

Example:
0 success
--
name daai
imageUrl http://9x9ui.s3.amazonaws.com/9x9playerV52/images/logo_tzuchi.png
intro daai
--
name Daai3x3
imageUrl null
--
1 396 channel1 channel1 http://podcast.daaitv.org/Daai_TV_Podcast/da_ai_dian_shi/da_ai_dian_shi_files/shapeimage_3.png 3 0 0 2
2 399 channel2 channel2 http://podcast.daaitv.org/Daai_TV_Podcast/jing_si_yu/jing_si_yu_files/shapeimage_4.png 3 0 0 2

unsubscribe

@RequestMapping(value="unsubscribe")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.String> unsubscribe(@RequestParam(value="user",required=false)
                                                                                            java.lang.String userToken,
                                                                                            @RequestParam(value="channel",required=false)
                                                                                            java.lang.String channelId,
                                                                                            @RequestParam(value="grid",required=false)
                                                                                            java.lang.String grid,
                                                                                            @RequestParam(value="set",required=false)
                                                                                            java.lang.String setId,
                                                                                            javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req,
                                                                                            javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse resp)
User unsubscribes a channel or a set. To unsubscribe a channel, use params channel and grid; to unsubscribe a set, use param set.

Example: http://host:port/playerAPI/unsubscribe?user=QQl0l208W2C4F008980F&channel=51

Parameters:
user - user's unique identifier
channel - channelId
grid - grid location. use with channel. giving channel only is valid (for backward compatibility), but since one channel can exist on multiple locations in a smart guide, it could result in unsubscribing on an unexpected grid location.
set - set id.
Returns:
status code and status message

channelSubmit

@RequestMapping(value="channelSubmit")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.String> channelSubmit(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req)
Generate a channel based on a podcast RSS feed or a YouTube URL.

Only POST operation is supported.

Parameters:
url - YouTube url
user - user's unique identifier
grid - grid location, 1 - 81
category - category id, not mandatory
langCode - language code, en or zh.
tag - tag string, separated by comma
Returns:
channel id, channel name, image url.

channelBrowse

@RequestMapping(value="channelBrowse")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.String> channelBrowse(@RequestParam(value="category",required=false)
                                                                                              java.lang.String categoryIds,
                                                                                              @RequestParam(value="lang",required=false)
                                                                                              java.lang.String lang,
                                                                                              javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req,
                                                                                              javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse resp)
Deprecated. Please use category instead. Browse all the on-air channels by category.

Parameters:
category - category id
Returns:
Category info and channels info.
First section is category info, follows channels info. Each channel is \n separated.
Category info has category id.
Channel info includes channel id, channel name, channel image url, program count, subscription count, channel type, channel episodes last update time
Example:
0 success
--
1174
--
0 1207 Etsy http://s3.amazonaws.com/9x9chthumb/a.gif 2 2 2
0 1217 System http://s3.amazonaws.com/9x9chthumb/b.gif 1 2 2

channel episodes last update time: please look up the definition in channelLineup

@RequestMapping(value="categoryBrowse")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.String> categoryBrowse(@RequestParam(value="lang",required=false)
                                                                                               java.lang.String lang,
                                                                                               javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req,
                                                                                               javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse resp)
Deprecated. Please use category instead. Browse categories.

Returns:
Categories info. Each category is \n separated.
Category info has category id, category name, channel count.

channelLineup

@RequestMapping(value="channelLineup")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.String> channelLineup(@RequestParam(value="user",required=false)
                                                                                              java.lang.String userToken,
                                                                                              @RequestParam(value="userInfo",required=false)
                                                                                              java.lang.String userInfo,
                                                                                              @RequestParam(value="channel",required=false)
                                                                                              java.lang.String channelIds,
                                                                                              @RequestParam(value="setInfo",required=false)
                                                                                              java.lang.String setInfo,
                                                                                              @RequestParam(value="required",required=false)
                                                                                              java.lang.String required,
                                                                                              javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req,
                                                                                              javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse resp)
Get channel information

Parameters:
user - user's unique identifier
userInfo - true or false. Whether to return user information as login does. If asked, it will be returned after status code.
channel - channel id, optional, can be one or multiple; example, channel=1 or channel=1,2,3
setInfo - true or false. Whether to return set information.
required - true or false. Will return error in status block if the requested channel is not found.
Returns:
A string of all of requested channel information

First block: status. Second block: set information. This block shows only if setInfo is set to true. Third block: channel information. It would be the second block if setInfo is false

Set info has following fields:
position, set id, set name, set image url, set type

Channel info has following fields:
grid position,
channel id,
channel name,
channel description,
channel image url,
program count,
channel type(integer, see note),
channel status(integer, see note),
contentType(integer, see note),
youtube id (for player youtube query),
channel/episodes last update time (see note)
channel sorting (see note),
piwik id,
last watched episode
youtube real channel name
subscription count

set type: TYPE_USER = 1; TYPE_READONLY = 2;

channel type: TYPE_GENERAL = 1; TYPE_READONLY = 2;

status: STATUS_SUCCESS = 0; STATUS_ERROR = 1;

contentType: SYSTEM_CHANNEL=1; PODCAST=2; YOUTUBE_CHANNEL=3; YOUTUBE_PLAYERLIST=4 FACEBOOK_CHANNEL=5; MIX_CHANNEL=6; SLIDE=7; MAPLESTAGE_VARIETY=8; MAPLESTAGE_SOAP=9

channel episodes last update time: it does not always accurate on Youtube channels. It will pass channel create date on FB channels.

sorting: NEWEST_TO_OLDEST=1; SORT_OLDEST_TO_NEWEST=2; SORT_MAPEL=3

Example:
0 success
--
1239 1 Daai3x3 null
--
1 1207 Channel1 http://hostname/images/img.jpg 3 1 0 3 http://www.youtube.com/user/android

moveChannel

programInfo

@RequestMapping(value="programInfo")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.String> programInfo(@RequestParam(value="channel",required=false)
                                                                                            java.lang.String channelIds,
                                                                                            @RequestParam(value="user",required=false)
                                                                                            java.lang.String userToken,
                                                                                            @RequestParam(value="userInfo",required=false)
                                                                                            java.lang.String userInfo,
                                                                                            @RequestParam(value="ipg",required=false)
                                                                                            java.lang.String ipgId,
                                                                                            @RequestParam(value="sidx",required=false)
                                                                                            java.lang.String sidx,
                                                                                            @RequestParam(value="limit",required=false)
                                                                                            java.lang.String limit,
                                                                                            javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req,
                                                                                            javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse resp)
Get program information based on query criteria.

Examples:
http://host:port/playerAPI/programInfo?channel=*&user=QQl0l208W2C4F008980F
http://host:port/playerAPI/programInfo?channel=*&ipg=13671109
http://host:port/playerAPI/programInfo?channel=153,158
http://host:port/playerAPI/programInfo?channel=153

Parameters:
channel - (1)Could be *, all the programs, e.g. channel=* (user is required for wildcard query). (2)Could be a channel Id, e.g. channel=1
(3)Could be list of channels, e.g. channels = 34,35,36.
user - user's unique identifier, it is required for wildcard query
userInfo - true or false. Whether to return user information as login. If asked, it will be returned after status code.
ipg - ipg's unique identifier, it is required for wildcard query
sidx - start index, use with limit
limit - use with sidx, entries of queries. example, sidx=10 and limit=5 will return 5 entries starting from entry 10.
Returns:

Programs info. Each program is separate by \n.

Program info has:
channelId, programId, programName, description(max length=256),
programType, duration,
programThumbnailUrl, programLargeThumbnailUrl,
url1(mpeg4/slideshow), url2(webm), url3(flv more likely), url4(audio),
publish date timestamp, curator comment.

pdr

@RequestMapping(value="pdr")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.String> pdr(@RequestParam(value="user",required=false)
                                                                                    java.lang.String userToken,
                                                                                    @RequestParam(value="device",required=false)
                                                                                    java.lang.String deviceToken,
                                                                                    @RequestParam(value="session",required=false)
                                                                                    java.lang.String session,
                                                                                    @RequestParam(value="pdr",required=false)
                                                                                    java.lang.String pdr,
                                                                                    javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req,
                                                                                    javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse resp)
Collecting PDR

Parameters:
user - user token
session - indicates the session when user starts using the player
pdr - pdr data

Expecting lines(separated by \n) of the following:
delta verb info
Example: delta watched 1 1 2 3
Note: first 1 is channel, the rest are program ids.
Note: each field is separated by tab.

category

@RequestMapping(value="category")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.String> category(@RequestParam(value="category",required=false)
                                                                                         java.lang.String category,
                                                                                         @RequestParam(value="lang",required=false)
                                                                                         java.lang.String lang,
                                                                                         javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req,
                                                                                         javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse resp)
For directory query. Depending on the query level, it returns category, set, or channel info. API returns list of category info until it reaches category leaf. API returns list of set info when the query "category" is a set. API returns list channel info when the query "category" is a set.

Parameters:
category - category id, category id empty indicates top level category query
lang - en or zh
Returns:

Block one, the requested category. Block two, category or set info. Block three, channel info. Block can be blank if such info does not exist.

Category info includes id, name, channel count, sub-category count

Set info includes set id, set name, channel count

Channel info please refer to channelLineup

recentlyWatched

@RequestMapping(value="recentlyWatched")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.String> recentlyWatched(@RequestParam(value="user",required=false)
                                                                                                java.lang.String userToken,
                                                                                                @RequestParam(value="count",required=false)
                                                                                                java.lang.String count,
                                                                                                @RequestParam(value="channelInfo",required=false)
                                                                                                java.lang.String channelInfo,
                                                                                                javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req)
User's recently watched channel and its episode

Parameters:
user - user token
count - number of recently watched entries
channelInfo - true or false
Returns:
Fist block: Lines of channel id and program id.
Second block: if channelInfo is set to true, detail channel information will be returned. Please reference channelLineup for format.
